"You cannot realise water's importance until you miss it".  A #WorldWaterDay video from the 2012 World Water Forum.
http://t.co/3kw2bSJV
Our #WorldWaterDay chat has ended. For more information on #water in Europe and internationally see http://t.co/tcrfNKdk. #EEAchat
We can make choices which do not deprive others of #water, eg eating less meat and not buying vegetables from water-stressed areas #EEAchat
In many parts of the world, including Europe, we need to rethink our consumption habits. Water is not an endless resource #EEAchat
Q. Is it possible to provide clean tap #water for everyone? Would that mean  we need to drastically rethink our consumption habits? #EEAchat
As a consumer ask your #water provider for information on the quality of your tap water. This can help improve your water quality #EEAchat
All EU countries have to comply with these two #water directives, but some might choose to apply even higher standards #EEAchat
In Europe there is the Water Framework Directive, which sets the quality standards at large, and the Drinking Water Directive #EEAchat
Q. The quality of tap #water is very different throughout the world. Who actually decides what the quality should be like? #EEAchat
Water saving devices reduce the amount of #water you use. Also avoid washing your car or watering your garden during dry periods #EEAchat
Q. How can I reduce my #water consumption in my everyday life? Which of my actions would have the biggest impact? #EEAchat
If #water is polluted near your home, then the price is higher because the utility has to bring water from further away #EEAchat
Authorities and utilities set #water prices by considering the difficulties with getting, treating and bringing it to consumers #EEAchat
Q. In what European country is a glass of tap #water most expensive? And where is it cheapest? What explains the price difference? #EEAchat
It is often suitable to have an independent treatment system, but biological treatment is only suitable for biodegradeable #waste #EEAchat
Q. Is there any value in having self-contained #water treatment systems that emit no pollution in hard-to-reach areas? #EEAchat #sanitation
There is also a social aspect to #water pricing. Water has its costs but people on a low income should be able to pay their bill #EEAchat
Water authorities are trying to include environmental aspects into water economics, but the whole system of tools should be used #EEAchat
Q. Incorporating environmental costs is a challenge for all natural resources used. How can we approach this in the case of #water? #EEAchat
We can also improve how we manage #water technically so we waste less. In Europe 25% of domestic water is used to flush the toilet! #EEAchat
#Water pricing should reflect its true value, incorporating all the environmental costs. This would make water users more efficient #EEAchat
Q. What mechanisms are available to reduce #water consumption? Increased taxation, setting quotas? #EEAchat
In Europe the Water Framework Directive is a success story; it has increased coordination across countries and related policy areas #EEAchat
Q. Which European trans-boundary #water management success stories can be applied to Australia's water management plan efforts? #EEAchat
Due to #ClimateChange, #Turkey may face #water scarcity. Also reduced quality, higher chemical concentrations & higher water temp. #EEAchat
Q. I read that climate change is going to affect #water quality and quantity. I am from #Turkey. What should we expect? #EEAchat
Blue flag schemes consider #EU law & other criteria eg beach access & facilities. For more on Europe's beaches http://t.co/irsATU9z #EEAchat
Q. So what country in Europe has the most blue-flag-rated bathing beaches? #EEAchat
We will be tweeting questions and answers from our #WorldWaterDay facebook chat with the hashtag #EEAchat
